extendedIngredients.name: cooked polenta
extendedIngredients.original: 1 18-ounce tube prepared polenta, sliced into 12 rounds
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 18-ounce tube prepared polenta, sliced into 12 rounds

extendedIngredients.name: dried chorizo
extendedIngredients.original: 2 ounces dried chorizo, thinly sliced (about 1/2 cup)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 ounces dried chorizo, thinly sliced (about 1/2 cup)

extendedIngredients.name: juice of lime
extendedIngredients.original: Juice of 1 lime, plus wedges for serving
extendedIngredients.originalString: Juice of 1 lime, plus wedges for serving
extendedIngredients.originalName: Juice of lime, plus wedges for serving

extendedIngredients.name: red jalapeno pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1 Fresno chile or red jalapeno pepper, quartered (remove seeds for less heat)

extendedIngredients.originalName: Fresno chile or red jalapeno pepper, quartered (remove seeds for less heat)

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken thighs
extendedIngredients.original: 1 3/4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs (about 6), halved
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 3/4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs (about 6), halved

title: Chicken and Chorizo Packets
instructions: Cook the chorizo in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon; set aside. Reserve the drippings; let cool slightly.                          Combine the chile, scallions, cilantro, garlic, oregano and cumin in a food processor. Add 2 tablespoons water, the reserved drippings, the lime juice and 1/4 teaspoon salt; pulse to make a coarse paste. Transfer the paste to a large bowl, add the chicken and toss to coat; cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.                          Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Tear off four 16-inch sheets of parchment paper. Make the packets (see photo gallery): Arrange 3 slices polenta on one sheet of parchment; top with one-quarter each of the bell peppers, chorizo and chicken. Seal as directed. Repeat to make 3 more packets; divide between 2 baking sheets.                          Transfer to the oven and bake until the parchment puffs and the chicken is cooked through, about 30 minutes. Let rest 5 minutes. Carefully open the packets; sprinkle with the cheese and serve with lime wedges.                          Photograph by David Malosh

steps.step: Cook the chorizo in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 5 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon; set aside. Reserve the drippings; let cool slightly.
Combine the chile, scallions, cilantro, garlic, oregano and cumin in a food processor.
Add 2 tablespoons water, the reserved drippings, the lime juice and 1/4 teaspoon salt; pulse to make a coarse paste.
Transfer the paste to a large bowl, add the chicken and toss to coat; cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Tear off four 16-inch sheets of parchment paper. Make the packets (see photo gallery): Arrange 3 slices polenta on one sheet of parchment; top with one-quarter each of the bell peppers, chorizo and chicken. Seal as directed. Repeat to make 3 more packets; divide between 2 baking sheets.
Transfer to the oven and bake until the parchment puffs and the chicken is cooked through, about 30 minutes.
Let rest 5 minutes. Carefully open the packets; sprinkle with the cheese and serve with lime wedges.
